page.title: 02FARMING AROUND STOTTESDON
page.content: In the block are about 20 farms ranging from 3 acres to 600+ acres. The smallest is a specialised poultry unit growing no crops and is atypical. Otherwise the area is divided roughly 55/45 between grassland & arable. 60% of the farms have a dairy herd as the main source of income, generally supported by livestock rearing(beef &/ or sheep). Mostly, grain & grass are grown for fodder. All farms are of a similar mixed pattern, the various enterprises being so interdependent that it is not possible to say which is the main one. 60% of the farms are owner occupied. Most of the rest are rented from the Burwarton Estate. 50% have been in the same family for more than one generation, & of the rest several will be passed to sons who are already working on the farms. 80% of workers are the farmer's own family.
